paragraphs: After a year filled with Zoom and FaceTime calls, there’s something so therapeutic about disconnecting from the internet and getting back to the basics. To enjoy the simpler things in life (i.e. a blank page to fill), start by grabbing one of the best planners for 2021. Having a place to jot down your notes and ideas will not only give you a much-needed break from all of your devices, but it’ll also make you feel a bit more organized, whether you’re recording home improvement plans, fitness goals, important dates, or motivational quotes.

Vogue’s fashion news editor Sarah Spellings relies on the dotted version of Leuchtturm planner, which will help anyone stay on top of the nitty-gritty details of each month, week, and day. “I use the medium-sized Leuchtturm notebook (the best part is selecting a color),” says Spellings. “The pages are great quality, and pre-numbered. Then, I watch YouTube videos of bullet journalers and take ideas for how to organize my to-do lists, goals, and long-term projects into one book.”

If you’re the type of person that wants something that feels like eye candy on your desk, go all out with a luxurious Smythson agenda book. It comes with a coordinated gold-trimmed pencil that’ll make you feel luxuriously studious while you’re taking notes. You could also grab a reusable agenda cover by your favorite fashion designer. There’s truly something out there for everyone, but we’ve made the search easier by gathering the best planners for 2021, ahead.
